intro: Brachystelma subaphyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and flowers that often resemble insects. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are small, thick, and arranged in a rosette, helping to store water and reduce transpiration. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, appearing in late spring or early summer.
